paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information related to the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.phenotype_details: cardiac amyloidosis with heart failure symptoms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most common mutations are the valine-to-isoleucine mutation at position 122 (Val122I), carried by 3–4% of the African-Americans leading to late-onset cardiac amyloidosis.
In this cohort, 6 individuals were found to be unaffected despite carrying the Val122I mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Val122I mutation leads to misfolding of the TTR protein, contributing to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of cardiac amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance data is stratified by age, indicating higher penetrance in older age groups.
key_quotes: The most common mutations are the valine-to-isoleucine mutation at position 122 (Val122I), carried by 3–4% of the African-Americans leading to late-onset cardiac amyloidosis.
In this cohort, 6 individuals were found to be unaffected despite carrying the Val122I mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, focusing on the TTR gene.
